column1: A list of cities in Poland
column2: preceded by a table of major Polish cities. The table ranks cities by population based on data from the Central Statistical Office of Poland. Note that in the Polish system of administration there is no difference between a city and a town. There are only cities (having city rights) and villages (which do not have city rights).

According to the law there are two main types of localities (Polish: miejscowość):
a) independent localities (miejscowość samodzielna) called in register as basic localities (miejscowość podstawowa) - e.g. a city/town and a village
b) not independent localities (miejscowość niesamodzielna) integral parts of localities

column1: A statistical locality (miejscowość statystyczna) is a separated collection of several localities (out of all 23 types) for statistical purposes
column2: for which statistical data are collected and compiled together. In a special case
column3: the team may contain only one locality. There are two types of statistical localities:
